searchDocs.title: 🌟 Features
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: 🌟 Features​
searchDocs.content: Parsing of simple markdown syntax such as: paragraphheaderhorizontal rulelistlinkimageformatting such as italic, bold, bold italic, code, emphasis Partial extended markdown syntax support such as: alternate header syntaxblockquotescode blockcommentsdefinition listtask listadditional formatting syntax such as subscript,superscript, strikethrough, highlight, etc Simple UI for a markdown editor allowing a user to enter markdown and view resulting html rendered in a side-by-side viewAbility to save and clear markdown content to and from local storageAbility to grow and accomodate additional syntax by updating the defined grammar file

searchDocs.title: Unsupported Markdown Syntax​
searchDocs.content: Nested lists (and inclusion of other elements within lists)Nested blockquotes (with different levels)TablesFootnotesReference LinksEmoji Support (currently pasting emojis is supported, but for example :joy: does not return an emoji with its resulting unicode representation)  A comprehensive overview detailing all supported Markdown syntax can be located within the documentation under the Syntax Overview section. Each element has a dedicated page detailing an overview of what the element is and example input Markdown and resulting output HTML.

searchDocs.title: Bold
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: Bold is one of the many formatting options available within Markdown. It is typically used to ensure that a selection of text stands out from the rest of the text. It is denoted by wrapping the desired text with **.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: **This text is bolded** and this text is not.   <p><strong>This text is bolded</strong> and this text is not.</p>

searchDocs.title: Emphasis
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: Emphasis is one of the many formatting options available within Markdown. It is typically used to highlight a selection of text. It is indicated by wrapping the desired text with ==.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: ==This text is emphasized== and this text is not.   <p><mark>This text is emphasized</mark> and this text is not.</p>

searchDocs.title: Bold Italic
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: Bold Italic is one of the many formatting options available within Markdown. It is a combination of bold and italic formatting. This is typically denoted by wrapping the desired text with ***.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: ***This text is bold and italic*** and this text is not.   <p> <em><strong>This text is bold and italic</strong></em> and this text is not. </p>

searchDocs.title: Code Block
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A code block is an element which is typically used to represent code and is similar to the inline code formatting option, except that it allows for multi-line content. This element is denoted by using ```.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: <!-- Ignore the `\` present, this is simply used to escape the backticks. --> \``` This is text within a code block. \```   <pre> <code>This is text within a code block.</code> </pre>

searchDocs.title: Horizontal Rule
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A horizontal rule is an element which is usually used to separate different sections of text from each other, it is visually represented by a horizontal line. This is typically denoted using --- / *** / ___ on a blank line.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: --- *** ___   <hr /> <hr /> <hr />

searchDocs.title: HTML Tag
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: HTML Tag refers to elements within the HyperText Markup Language (HTML) such as <p>, <h1>, etc.  At present, all HTML tags are not rendered by the parser, but are captured accordingly.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: <p>This is a paragraph element using HTML. </p> This is a paragraph element using Markdown.   <p>This is a paragraph element using Markdown.</p>

searchDocs.title: ✨ Acknowledgements
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: ✨ Acknowledgments​
searchDocs.content: Peggy.jsPeggy.js Online EditorPeggy.js DocumentationMarkdown Guide Cheatsheetregex101Fl0DocusaurusGitHub PagesShields BadgesFavicon Generator

searchDocs.title: Italic
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: Italic is one of the many formatting options available within Markdown. It is typically used to ensure that a selection of text stands out from the rest of the text. It is denoted by wrapping the desired text with *.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: *This text is italic* and this text is not.   <p><em>This text is italic</em> and this text is not.</p>

searchDocs.title: List
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A list is an element that is typically used to group related content together. Lists come in two main forms unordered and ordered lists.  Unordered lists are denoted by a - and ordered lists are denoted by a number followed by a decimal and a space (i.e. 1.).

searchDocs.title: Unordered List​
searchDocs.content: - This is an unordered list item - This is an unordered list item 2   <ul> <li>This is an unordered list item</li> <li>This is an unordered list item 2</li> </ul>

searchDocs.title: Ordered List​
searchDocs.content: 1. This is an ordered list item 2. This is an ordered list item 2   <ol> <li>This is an ordered list item</li> <li>This is an ordered list item 2</li> </ol>

searchDocs.title: Paragraph
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A paragraph is a block of text that can include formatting options such as bold, italic, link, etc.  Paragraphs can additionally use something known as hard break and soft break which is used to determine how a paragraph should be rendered under certain conditions.

searchDocs.title: Normal Paragraph​
searchDocs.content: This is a simple paragraph.   <p>This is a simple paragraph.</p>

searchDocs.title: Paragraph with Formatting​
searchDocs.content: This is a paragraph with *formatting* options such as `bold`, `code`. Additionally, you can also use links such as [link](google.com).   <p>This is a paragraph with <em>formatting</em> options such as <code>bold</code>, <code>code</code>.</p> <p>Additionally, you can also use links such as <a href="google.com">link</a>.</p>

searchDocs.title: Paragraphs - Soft vs. Hard Break​
searchDocs.content: Soft Break​  This is paragraph 1. And this is a continuation of paragraph 1.   <p>This is paragraph 1.<br />And this is a continuation of paragraph 1.</p>   Hard Break​  This is paragraph 1. This is paragraph 2.   <p>This is paragraph 1.</p> <p>This is paragraph 2.</p>

searchDocs.title: Image
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: An image is an element that can visually enhance text by embedding an image into the document. The image element can additionally have an optional title attribute.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: ![image](https://example.com) ![image](https://example.com "This is a image title")   <p> <img src="https://example.com" alt="image" /> </p> <p> <img src="https://example.com" alt="image" title="This is a image title" /> </p>

searchDocs.title: Link
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A link is an element which allows for the creation of a hyperlink pointing to a specific url. This link element can additionally have an optional title attribute. Links are represented by <a>.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: [link](https://example.com) [link](https://example.com "This is a link title")   <p> <a href="https://example.com">link</a> </p> <p> <a href="https://example.com" title="This is a link title">link</a> </p>

searchDocs.title: 📜 Available Scripts
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: 📜 Available Scripts​
searchDocs.content: Start the app in the development environment.  npm run start   Build the project files and optimize for production.  npm run build   Lint all files and check if there are any issues, with ESLint.  npm run lint   Fix all ESLint issues then format the files with Prettier.  npm run prettier   Generate a parser using the defined grammar.pegjs file with Peggy.js.  npm run parser   Run all tests.  npm test

searchDocs.title: Code
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: Code is one of the many formatting options available within Markdown. It is typically used to denote a selection of text as code. It is indicated by wrapping the desired text with `.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: `This is an inline code text` and this is not.   <p><code>This is an inline code text</code> and this is not.</p>

searchDocs.title: ⚡ Setup
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: ⚡ Setup Instructions​
searchDocs.content: Clone this repository to your local machine.  git clone https://github.com/vikiru/parseum.git cd parseum   Download and install all required dependencies.  npm install

searchDocs.title: 📝 Prerequisites
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: 📝 Prerequisites​
searchDocs.content: Ensure that the following dependencies are installed onto your machine by following the Setup Instructions.  Node.js

searchDocs.title: Header
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A header is an element that is usually used to represent the title of a distinct section of text, denoted by a #. A header ranges from level 1 to level 6, where the level of the header is determined by the number of # characters and if the number of # characters exceeds 6, it will be parsed as a paragraph.

searchDocs.title: Normal Header Syntax (ATX Header)​
searchDocs.content: # This is a header of level 1 ## This is a header of level 2 ### This is a header of level 3 #### This is a header of level 4 ##### This is a header of level 5 ###### This is a header of level 6 ####### This is a normal paragraph.   <h1>This is a header of level 1</h1> <h2>This is a header of level 2</h2> <h3>This is a header of level 3</h3> <h4>This is a header of level 4</h4> <h5>This is a header of level 5</h5> <h6>This is a header of level 6</h6> <p>####### This is a normal paragraph.</p>

searchDocs.title: Alternate Header Syntax (Setext Header)​
searchDocs.content: Header Level 1 ===== Header Level 2 -----   <h1>Header Level 1</h1> <h2>Header Level 2</h2>

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Tech Stack
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Tech Stack​
searchDocs.content: Backend:  Node.jsPeggy.js  Frontend:  ReactTailwindCSSDaisyUI  Hosting:  Fl0  Documentation:  Docs are built using Docusaurus Search functionality provided by: docusaurus-lunr-searchAnalytics using Google Analytics Documentation site hosted via GitHub Pages  Dev Tools:  ESLintPrettierWakaTimePeggy.js Online Editor

searchDocs.title: Strikethrough
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: Strikethrough is one of the many formatting options available within Markdown. It is typically used to denote a selection of text that should be deleted or crossed out. It is indicated by wrapping the desired text with ~~.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: ~~~This text is using strikethrough~~ and this text is not.   <p><del>~This text is using strikethrough</del> and this text is not.</p>

searchDocs.title: Superscript
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: Superscript is one of the many formatting options available within Markdown, although typically not supported by most parsers. It is typically used to denote a selection of text that should be rendered visually different from other text.  Superscript text is usually smaller and aligned vertically higher compared to other text. Superscript text is denoted by wrapping the desired text with ^.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: This text is not using a superscript, but this ^text^ is.   <p>This text is not using a superscript, but this <sup>text</sup> is.</p>

searchDocs.title: Subscript
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: Subscript is one of the many formatting options available within Markdown, although typically not supported by most parsers. It is typically used to denote a selection of text that should be rendered visually different from other text.  Subscript text is usually smaller and aligned vertically lower compared to other text. Subscript text is denoted by wrapping the desired text with ~.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: This text is not using a subscript, but this ~text~ is.   <p>This text is not using a subscript, but this <sub>text</sub> is.</p>

searchDocs.title: 🔍 Testing
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: 🔍 Testing​
searchDocs.content: The comprehensive suite of tests for this project is housed within the test directory. These tests are primarily designed to verify the functionality of the parser and ensure that the resulting HTML is as expected for the input Markdown.  The tests can be run with the following command:  npm test

searchDocs.title: Task List
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A task list is an element typically used to create a list of tasks, each with a status denoted by the presence of a checkbox which can be either checked or unchecked.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: - [ ] Finish writing documentation for Parseum - [x] Finish Parseum Backend and Frontend   <ul> <li><input type="checkbox" disabled />Finish writing documentation for Parseum</li> <li><input type="checkbox" checked disabled />Finish Markdown Parser and Editor Backend and Frontend</li> </ul>

searchDocs.title: 📝 Syntax Overview
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: 📝 Syntax Overview​
searchDocs.content: 📝 Syntax Overview Basic SyntaxFormatting SyntaxExtended SyntaxExcluded Syntax

searchDocs.title: Basic Syntax​
searchDocs.content: ParagraphHeaderHorizontal RuleListLinkImage

searchDocs.title: Formatting Syntax​
searchDocs.content: ItalicBoldBold ItalicCodeEmphasis

searchDocs.title: Extended Syntax​
searchDocs.content: Auto LinkBlockquoteCode BlockDefinition ListTask ListStrikethroughSubscriptSuperscript

searchDocs.title: Excluded Syntax​
searchDocs.content: HTML TagsComment

searchDocs.title: Comment
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A comment is an element not typically supported by many Markdown parsers, however the purpose is to provide a way for users to add for example, explantory text to sections without impacting the rendered html.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: [comment1]: # This is a comment. This is a normal paragraph element.   <p>This is a normal paragraph element.</p>

searchDocs.title: Definition List
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A definition list is an element which allows for the creation of lists of terms followed by their definitions.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: First Term : This is the definition of the first term.   <dl> <dt>First Term</dt> <dd>This is the definition of the first term.</dd> </dl>

searchDocs.title: Autolink
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: An auto link is a hyperlink to a given url, represented by an anchor tag (<a>). The link is enclosed between an < and >.

searchDocs.title: Example Syntax​
searchDocs.content: <http://www.google.com> <https://www.google.com> <www.google.com>   <p> <a href="http://www.google.com">http://www.google.com</a> </p> <p> <a href="https://www.google.com">https://www.google.com</a> </p> <p> <a href="www.google.com">www.google.com</a> </p>

searchDocs.title: Blockquote
searchDocs.keywords: Parseum  markdown  html  parser  editor  peggy.js  react  tailwindcss  daisyui

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: A blockquote is an element which represents a section of text that is typically referenced from another source. The blockquote element is indicated using a > followed by the content, subsequent lines can optionally include > or not. To separate the blockquote from other elements, a new line is needed at the end.  At present, it is possible to include a paragraph and lists within blockquotes.

searchDocs.title: Paragraph within Blockquote​
searchDocs.content: > This is a paragraph within a blockquote.   <blockquote> <p>This is a paragraph within a blockquote.</p> </blockquote>

searchDocs.title: Lists within Blockquote​
searchDocs.content: > 1. This is a list item within a blockquote. > 2. This is another list item within a blockquote.   <blockquote> <ol> <li>This is a list item within a blockquote.</li> <li>This is another list item within a blockquote.</li> </ol> </blockquote>

searchDocs.title: Two Separate Blockquotes​
searchDocs.content: > This is quote number 1 > This is quote number 2   <blockquote> <p>This is quote number 1</p> </blockquote> <blockquote> <p>This is quote number 2</p> </blockquote>
